review: Just updating my last review.  Took my 9 yo along with his friends after we spent a few hours at the Pier.  The service has improved dramatically.  quick, friendly, and clean.  whatever you're doing works!
Dirty soda machine, rude service to certain cultures. Overpriced for what size pizza we got. Too greasy. Not worth another visit. We could have had better pizza a few shops down the promenade.

What a wonderful place to eat. The selection is really amazing. My wife and I went here for dinner and the food was very delicious. I had the Fish Tacos and my wife had the Chopped Chicken Salad. Both meals were great. There are so many other things on the menu that look good, so we will definitely go back to try some more.

I am a fan. Hadn't been in years, didn't know what to expect. The boyfriend and I went on a whim. Our service was excellent. The food was great. We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.  I hope when you go, you get Leah as your server. She was awesome

This location near the promenade is always busy  The food is unique because there are toppings not normally used for pizza Some of it is good, other dishes not so much Good service but not really authentic italian style pizza Give it a try to see if it is your thing

I've been here twice when I'm in the area. So far so good. Decent food for the price. Location is good because is not inside the Promenade. You can just park around Wilshire and just walk to it. I always order the Artichoke Spinach pizza with Chicken (extra $) and thin crust (extra $). I've also tried the California Club pizza with bacon and avocado. All I could taste is the bacon which I'm not a big fan of. The Arugula salad is good for one, maybe too small for 2 people. Red sangrias are always refreshing but overpriced.  Service is good. Very friendly and quick (maybe because it was a Sunday night almost closing time)

Very tolerant of kids - great restaurant for a family outing with little ones.  Love the soups and appetizers. Pizza is delicious. I love it that they offer pasta + edamame for kids instead of the regular deep fried chicken fingers crap other places serve.

Went here yesterday, with some friends. Our waitress Kellie was very friendly and attentive to our needs. She did a great job. As a matter of fact I always experience great customer service at every CPK that I go to. I digress, I ordered the fried mac n' cheese things, and they weren't as good as previous times trying them. The mac n' cheese seemed a little cold inside. However I did order the vegetarian & eggplant pizza. It was my first time trying it. And let me tell you... That pizza is magnificent. A must try. I like CPK not my favorite pizza place, but the ingredients always are fresh and it's a nice change of pace from most pizza places.
I always get either the chicken waldorf salad or the 5 cheese and fresh heirloom tomatoes and basil pizza.  Soooo good!  Never a disappointment!

My office ordered lunch for 6 people. We had one of our reps pick it up. We ordered 4 salads with lots of extra dressing requests. When I ordered everything over the phone, the gentleman that helped me was great. He repeated my order back and it was perfect.  When we got the food at the office we were short 6 dressings. Big problem especially since the missing dressing was for the boss.  I called to inform them of the problem and they told me they were going to send a guy out to deliver them. Half hour later we finally got the dressings, but by that time, we were practically done with our lunches. I could have walked down to the restaurant and come back to the office faster than that.  If it was me managing the restaurant I would have delivered the dressing with a complimentary dessert or a coupon for something on our next trip, but nothing.  I love the food here, but the customer service was horrible, and that is why I'm giving them 2 stars.
Pretty much what you would expect from CPK.  The food was decent, the service was decent.  Not the most impressive place, but not bad either.

Good food! I ordered the Field Greens salad, the half caesar salad and the tostada pizza to go. I did not realize that they did not have curbside service. So I waited in the alley next to them and someone came out and gave me my food and change. I would not get the tostada pizza to go. I would only get it if I was going to eat there. Something about the time from the restaurant to home just did not go over well with the pizza. Everything other than that tasted really good and I would do take out from here again.

The food was good yes but I will return here for Scott!!! His service was amazing.  He was sweet and very sexy!  HIs customer was the best I have ever had.  He came back to check on us frequently and called us by our first name.  I will continue to go back just to see him!!!

Great food, poor service. And watch out for the bill. The waiter I got, Paulina, doesn't know how to charge correctly. She tried charging my friend double the amount. She didn't even apologize. and it seemed like forever before she came to our table even though the restaurant was nearly empty!

Happy new year! We came here on NYE around 7:30 to get a good base in our stomach before the all night binge drinking marathon.  Great decision.  4 guys. We were headed to The Penthouse at the Huntley shortly after around 9:15. It's right across the street, so it worked out perfectly. We were greeted promptly by a cute girl who sat us immediately. We sat in a booth. Very comfortable and relaxed environment. There were actually quite a few families there.  I can't remember our waiters name, but he kicked major butt. He was from Boston and had a very thick accent. Good lookin' redheaded guy.  He playfully bantered with us for awhile and was great at checking on us.  At one point, I even spilled my beer everywhere. I ordered a Samuel Adams Winter Lager on tap. I was telling a story about the time my friends neighbor got cock-blocked by Brian Urlacher and the next thing I know, my beer is all over the floor and table. I wasn't even drunk....haha.  Our waiter was on point. He came right over and got me a brand new beer. He also made a smart ass remark that killed at the table.  We ordered a BBQ Hawaiian pizza and a meat lovers pizza. The pizzas were good, but the portions were very weak. There were four of us. Two pizzas should have been enough. Also, they bring bread to the table, and we only got four pieces of bread. I was still hungry after the meal.  If the portions were bigger, this place would get 5 stars in my book.  Great service is really hard to come by, especially in SaMo, but this place was above and beyond.  PROS: Great service -Relaxed atmosphere and vibe -Quick -Delicious -BREAD! CONS: Terribly small portions I think I'll go back here by myself and eat a pizza by myself.  Enjoy the food and drinks - ask for the dude from Harvard Bar! Best,  Sean
Frequently come here with a large group and several children. Service is always speedy and servers are incredibly kind.  Thumbs up.

After eating a big meal of Thai food and getting some ice cream, I didn't think I'd be hungry however we spent a good 3 or 4 hours browsing the Barnes and Noble nearby after a while, I was feeling hunger pangs again. We got here about an hour and half before closing. The promenade was mostly empty by this late hour which means so was the restaurant. We were seated quickly in a booth and service is prompt and attentive.  Since it was late at night, I was freezing. I ordered a bowl of their tortilla soup and it hit the spot. Warmed me up and I was ready for the appetizer and the main meal. After quickly browsing, we both decided on the guacamole. It arrived a bit bland and we seasoned it with some table salt. Not bad after that but the portion is tiny. I don't think I'd order this again. I'm a big fan of guacamole and you have to give me more guac than that or give me equal shares of both or none at all. For my main meal, I went with the BLT pizza. It wasn't bad but I probably won't order it again. The chilled lettuce on top cools the whole pizza down which then gives it a weird taste. I like my pizza hot. This is probably a bad idea for a pizza. I do however enjoy their other pizza offerings.  Overall, it wasn't a bad meal. I enjoyed my pizza the next day as leftovers.

I went here two Saturdays ago and this place was packed. It was about mid afternoon too. The wait was quick tho.. About 15 mins and we where seated.The server came over immediately and asked us what we wanted to drink and about the specials that they had. When he came back with our drinks we ordered our main course. It took about 20 mins for us to get our food, which is okay considering it was a Saturday and it was packed!  Ohhh and the food was good as it normally is at CPK!

Came here with wife and kids for a lovely evening a few weeks ago.  Since we've been to CPK many times, we all had an idea of what we'd order. Service was fabulous, although I didn't catch the young man's name.  He was a tall, slender, Caucasian young fellow - who provided excellent service and obviously knew what he was doing (as do I).  Glad to discover good food and service in a CPK outside of the home area.

I love CPk! Best restaurant ever. I've been coming here for years and always get the tostada pizza and oh, my son gets the kids Mac and cheese! It's a yummy choice for grown ups too!:):)  Amazing service always! And don't leave without getting the tiramasu!!

Pizzas are big and there are plenty of flavors! Really hits the spot after a fun day at the beach and long walk around Third Street, but it is a bit expensive for a pizza place, since there are a ton of cheaper ones around SaMo.

This place is usually very busy, I guess we just got lucky or something and our service was not only fast, but very friendly. Food was cold, but great tasiting, we didn't care for the new bread or olive olive they served with it instead of butter. Thank you Pamela for going behove and beyond, we hope we get you as our waitress everytime we go in.
This is a chain.   The food is passable.  The service is nice.  Nothing special - but nothing bad. I enjoy their lunch salads - but I mostly go because it is convenient to my office.

This is the biggest CPK I've ever seen. Granted, I've been to only a couple, but... pretty spacious! Our waiter was a nice enough fellow, but for some reason his jokes left me pretty irritated with his service. Maybe I was just in a mood as I'd been up earlier than usual today. Anyway, I ordered the fire roasted chile relleno, which was delicious with its blend of chicken, cheese, beans, avocado salsa, and other delights, but small in proportion to the $11 cost in my opinion. It fell just short of being filling. I thought it'd be large enough to count as an entree, but really it seemed more to me as an appetizer. Perhaps it's just my native Texan-ness speaking here.

I was excited to have CPK for dinner last night.  (It had been so long and the kids I was watching wanted it.)  We were greeted by the hostess and taken right to our seats. That was good.  However, I was disappointed with our server.  We had to ask multiple times for more cheese sauce.  He told us that it was still cooking in the back.  Come on now!!!! Over 12 to 15 minutes to bring out a side of cheese for the children's mac and cheese.  That was ridiculous.  When he finally brought it out, he held a huge sundae in his other hand.  (Come on now, sir.)  They thought it was their sundae!!!!!!!    I shared the chicken lettuce wraps and they were tasty.  The lettuce cups get a 4stars, but the service brought down the points a LOT!
Meh. Food was okay, service was good. Salad just seemed fake if that's possible. Pizza wasn't blowing me away. I'd say this is comfortable and  boring choice in dining.
I love CPK. Not sure why it has 3-stars. Good prices, and good food. Definitely get the peach lemonade, it's the best drink by far.

Average pizza, good service, and slightly better than average prices.  We only came here because my buddy works there so we had the hook up.  I don't think I would come here if I didn't know someone who worked here.  There are so many other better places to eat that don't use below average ingredients.

Do you enjoy decent service and moderately attentive/intelligent waiters who don't leave you sitting at your table for up to 40+ minutes without so much as a status update regarding your food? Does it irk you when you watch patrons seated a good 20 minutes after you beginning to eat their meals while you sit, staring at your table  and wishing you'd gone anywhere else? Do you take offense when you ask for something simple, such as the check, and your waiter decides that he has better things to do? If so, avoid the CPK on Wilshire. If you decide to give it a try anyway and you're feeling extra masochistic/want to enjoy your meal with a side of all-consuming rage, ask for Leonardo, the worst server in the history of chain restaurant dining. My coworkers and I are partially to blame, I suppose. We've gone to this location more than a few times for our Friday group outings and we've always known the service has only barely toed the line of being passable. Perhaps we grew TOO comfortable with the location, however, as the service last time should've been a tip (something the waiters at this location rarely deserve) to never come back. 90 minutes to churn out salads and a pizza? In fairness, everyone has a bad day and since we'd become something like "regulars" at this CPK, we returned, promising to give it another chance. Never again. Leonardo, Leonardo, Leonardo... How can I begin to describe your rude, off-putting demeanor, ineptitude, and generally horrendous service? As a timeline, we arrived on 06/28/13 at 12:05 to a nearly empty restaurant and waited about 10 minutes as he ran around looking like a chicken with his head chopped off. After taking our orders, we waited. And waited. And waited. Around 12:40, we finally managed to flag him down and he said that the restaurant had been flooded with to-go orders and to be patient. Well, that might be a decent excuse if the patrons who'd been seated 15 minutes after us hadn't already begun eating. We asked him to bring our checks with our meals (if they ever came) because we had to get back to the office. We even left the credit cards out for him so it could be a quick exchange. Yet, when our food came, there were no checks. In fact, we had to BEG for him to bring us our bills and that prompted a very rude, "HOLD ON, I'M GETTING TO IT!", complete with a dismissive wave of the hand. Keep in mind, we asked for the checks around 12:40 and it was now 1PM. When he finally decided he couldn't find anymore excuses to ignore us, he took our cards and disappeared again, casually walking around and taking NEW orders rather than going to the cash register, which it turned out was also too much for him to handle. Since I'm being thorough, I guess I should also mention that when he brought us CPK's ongoing promotional "Thank You Cards", he threw them at us so disdainfully that they landed in a graceless pile on a plate, nearly splashing one of us with a bright pink sauce. I'm not entirely certain, but I believe that when your service is already as poor as Leonardo's, you should at least make an effort to preserve the few pennies that you've earned of your tip. I finally couldn't take it anymore and had to complain to the manager, who was, in my mind, the one redeeming part of this lunch venture (and the only reason this place deserves the 1 star that I'm giving it). If the rest of the staff at this restaurant had 1/1000000 of the professionalism as the nice Polish manager, whose name I don't know, I might come back. As it is, even with the free meal coupon, I will NOT be returning to this location because it isn't worth the horrible taste this branch leaves in my mouth. CPK on Wilshire, do yourself a favor before you lose all your regular patrons: fire Leonardo--heck, fire your entire current lunchtime wait staff, they're all equally bad--and hire people with a basic understanding of working in the food service industry. Actually, even a pack of monkeys might be better.

Called two other CPK restaurants to inquire if they are serving the Roasted Garlic Chicken Pizza, and this location was the only one that was able to provide me with a response of yes without having to speak with a manager. Yes, that means 5 Stars to me! Brentwood and Westwood responded no or said "yes we have the bbq chicken" when they actually did. Many people nowadays don't listen to full inquires but I only had to ask yes and the hostess told me when they started carrying it! I live closer to the Brentwood and Westwood locations but will be glad to drive to Santa Monica. Thank you Santa Monica CPK!!!!
I think CPK is alright. The food is dependable but just okay. I've always had extremely friendly service.

Came here with the fam and had a pretty average night.   The food ( Garlic Chicken Pizza and Quinoa Arugula Salad was pretty good...Nothing made us go "Holy Fire that is soo good!" But we were satisfied enough. The service was decent. Again, not amazing... But perfunctory.  In a nutshell: Could've been better, could've been worse. Worth a try? Yeah for sure.

This is a place I have always enjoyed, but today, it was bad, service stunk. To me, it appeared that the kitchen and servers were understaffed and overwhelmed. Our server was not very attentive. Our party of 5 people arrived before noon and the place was not very busy. Drink orders were taken and delivered but then NOTHING. It was as if we didn't exist. When we finally placed our orders two were screwed up. One in our party got his food 20 minutes after the rest of us. One very nice thing is because of the screwup they comp'd his meal.  Classy but it would have been better without the delay. Jerry s

New menu. Flatbreads! Frozen Lemonade! Butter Cake a la Mode Ice Cream! And Coke, no more Pepsi! Here I thought I was over "CPK," but they've found a way to charm me again. At least this location is likeable here at Santa Monica off Ocean Ave., I can't say that for all locations anymore. And it's true, I'll never quite get enough of their classic Thai Chicken Pizza (I have found a better version of it at "Lucifer's" in West Hollywood however, I haven't written a review yet for that one). #heart

Pretty good salad selections for lunch. I typically order the BBQ chicken or Thai Crunch salad. Half portion is enough for me. Hardly ever crowded during lunch rush so you can have a dine-in experience without being gone from the office 1+ hour if you work nearby. Parking is by street. Service is friendly. Parking by street.

I have gone hear before and had a great experience and normally they always give pretty good service. However this time was totally horrid except for the one waiter I dealt with.  I come inside the building and the hostess says hello then just looks at me. Then she asks would you like a seat I think well umm no shit ya think I came in here looking to eat would you like my money or not? Anywho she seats me then goes off and tells the waiter about his new table however instead of saying it to him personally she yells it across the entire business. It then turns out my waiter has maybe 3 tables in the entire building and the other guy has more than 10 tables to himself and the other waiters have a few aswell. I sat there for over 10 minutes never saw the waiter he never came over hostess never asked if I was being helped even though I was seated right behind them. Appareantly my waiter has time to be laughing kidding joking and yelling around the resturant about how a previous customer I saw seated along the wall walked off and didnt pay at all. Again not something that should be yelled across the entire resturant over and over and over again over another 10 minute period of me not being helped finally the other waiter who had more than ten tables came over and asked if I was being helped I said I think that guy is the waiter but I have never seen him nor heard from him in over 20 minutes now so no guess im not being helped. He said of well can I take your order than said but im not your waiter. At this point I just ordered my drink and food at the same time because who knows when someone would be back for my order. Now once I recieved my food the pizza looked good and smelled great like normal and until I picked up the slice the dough I dont think was cooked completely as the slice fell apart andd no matter how you held the thing just kept falling apart. I personally wish I would have just got up walked away and refused to pay for this food as it was disgusting. I wondered the entire time if there manager was on vacation and that was why they were acting like raging college kids at a party or something. Well just that one guy was behaving that way. I mean just kjepy running around talking laughing super loud yelling to other employees across the room just annoying while his other employees were working there buts off and he wasnt. I wont be a repeat customer again.

We have been here multiple times. The food is consistent and served in a decent amount of time. The staff is very friendly and let us use the restroom once for my 8 month old daughter even when I told them we were not dining there. Overall, nice place to hang out in Santa Monica.Not to mention, it is open fairly late.

We had a gift certificate which is the entire reason we ended up going here. It is convenient enough as it is within walking distance from our place and the server was perfectly fine. It's just not food I would eat if not for a gift certificate. The beer selections were ok, nothing out of the ordinary. Let's cut to the chase: you are going to this place because of the pizza, yes? There are much, much better options. Fresh Brothers just opened up at Lincoln and Broadway. Trastevere a few blocks away is more expensive but it is just flat out better pizza and food.

I visited this location yesterday and it was very pleasant. My server, Grant, had a very California attitude ( in a good way). I decided to ask if the Tomato Basil Spaghetti with grilled chicken could still be ordered. My request was obliged. The sauce here was a bit heavier but flavorful. I just added Parmesan cheese. No dessert was ordered, a rarity for me. The ambience was very alive but not noisy. (Very few parties that day.) I would gladly come back.

My husband and I had a great experience here! The main reason is because of kellie she's awesome so friendly and attentive she was amazing. The food was also prepared pretty fast and tasted great same as any other cpk but this location made a big impact on me because of the great service. When we go back hopefully we can sit in kellie's section again.

Great & Fast service, delicious food! The server gave us some bread while we were waiting for the food. I never had to ask the server to refill my drink because she was on top of that. Ordered chip with spinach dip to start, then garlic cream fettuccine and Thai chicken pizza. Everything was delicious and had to get a box for the pizza which we (2 of us) couldn't finish. There's a covered parking right across the street for cheap (metered indoor run by the city).

Absolutely the worst take out service in town. Slow, late....and no compensation for the wait time or the trouble. And to boot, I tipped them because I paid before they even started working on my order. Poor.
Penny gave us personable and quick accurate five star service I'm a snob and this location consistently  Is on point. Well done PENNY!

Every time I go to Santa Monica to surf I stop by CPK. I am a big fan of the Spinach Dip and the Thai Chicken Pizza. Surfing, the beaches and CPK make Santan Monica the best city in the country. If you are in town do not waste your time, eat at CPK and you will never regret!

Quick, easy, fast. I have been here by myself for a quick lunch plenty of times, with the boyfriend for dinner, with friends after shopping till we drop on the promenade, by myself after shopping, with the boyfriend for lunch. You get the drift. I am seriously here a lot. I try to avoid their pizzas, because then I feel like a fat ass. Though I always order the flat bread. The flat bread is pretty much pizza; but because it's smaller than a pizza I feel like I am being good. Call it cheating if you wish, I am in denial here.  I've never tried their cocktails here so can't comment too much on that, however my friends have ordered a few and said they weren't bad. Also if you are into salads but don't feel like downing a whole plate of greens I highly recommend the arugula asparagus mini plate. Yummy and hits the eating healthy spot. Also good service, and Pam rocks!
Exactly what you would expect--reliable food with reasonable service.  Chicken Fettucine Alfredo is delicious as are the salads.  Kids like the pizza.

It was what I expected from CPK. The service was nice but we came in at a slow time.  The location was clean and the seating was comfortable.  We had a pizza and a pasta. It was a lot of food for two people and had to get a box. They were both very nice. I would come here again.

Do not patronize this restaurant.  This has to be regarded as the evil stepsister to all other California Pizza Kitchens.  I eat at CPK's all over the city.  Enjoy the food and service all the time.  BUT THIS ONE IS BAD.  A half-filled restaurant at 7:30 p.m. should have been the tip-off to turn around and go somewhere else.  Fears where realized when orders were placed and the food arrived lukewarm, unseasoned, and bland.  Salmon was small and overcooked; spaghetti was plain and served with a teaspoon instead of a pasta spoon (We were told the pasta spoons were being washed. Yeeks!). The manager and staff are ill-trained. I am sure they mean well, but they are completely lost when anticipating the needs of a customer.  Initially sat down in a booth that had not been cleaned of debris from the previous diners only to sit in a pool of water that had accumulated from the air conditioner high above the restaurant floor. The manager explained without apologizing, "Oh, the water must be coming from the condenser. Do you still want to sit here?"  Run for the hills!  Second rate people hire third rate people, and third rate people cause restaurants to fold.  I suggest corporate take a close look at this one.

We have been tote CPK in marina del Rey about a month ago for the first time and loved it, it wasn't greasy, it was super crisp delicious pizza. Last night we decided to get two from out local California Pizza Kitchen. When we brought it home and tasted it we couldn't believe it was the same restaurant chain. It was greasy, soggy and with wayyyy too much salt.  The worst thing is that one of the pizzas was the same one we ordered at a different location. Try should be embarrassed and ashamed at serving us food like that for that price. Disgusting, and we are not coming back here again!! If I want to eat crap like this, I can order Pizza Hut.
Interesting locayion. The waiter has most likely been up since '08. The food here is awesome but full it tourists. They have lacrosse playing on the television, GO DUBS
The atmosphere was great , the customer service was pleasant. when it comes to food there is better options.  i had the Garlic cream fettuccine it was beyond greasy and insufficient for a meal.

I would say that this is a typical CPK location.  Overall the food is more unique style pizzas like taco pizza (which is really really good) or BBQ chicken pizza, etc.  They also have really good entrees like the tequila lime pasta.  The bread is good so ask for it.  The wait staff is average with no complaints from me.  You can often get a table without a wait.

Waiter is super friendly and very helpful. Stirred me clear of a drink that was on the not so good side and suggested a Caribbean Sangria. Whichh was pretty awesome. Also got the avocado rolls were pretty great and unique.

We went for dinner last night and one of us is a vegetarian and also gluten intolerant. Their gluten free menu for veggies is pretty limited and she ordered the margherita pizza which was about the only choice. The manager, Jake, found out and came over to us, explained their gluten free guidelines  and designed a special pizza for us and told the chef exactly how he wanted it prepared. It came out beautiful and delicious. Recommend this location.
So delicious! Best CPK in Los Angeles! Compliments to the chef, wait staff, and Colleen-the manager!! Thanks for an awesome family dinner!
LOVE their pasta, yum!  The only thing I dont like is the decoration, and sometimes the service is a bit bad.
Met a friend there for lunch. Great bottle of wine, Hawaiian Pizza, salad, pasta and chocolate desert. the wait staff was very good as well.

One thing i love about CPK is that the food is always the same, it never tastes different and i already know what i want. For years on end i either get the BBQ pizza (thin crust) or the thai crunch salad with avocado with a cup of the best tortilla soup i have ever had. The tortilla soup is more creamy rather than spicy. The thai crunch is probably my all time favorite and never fails. This CPK is pretty awesome since they are open to 11pm, i came in around 10 and they still serve all the same things and the service is faster to, otherwise the service could be hit or miss.

I came here for the first time today and was satisfied! The food tasted great and the service was quick. A really quiet and nice environment. The server was excellent! He was extremely helpful and considerate. Will be coming back for sure!

The service was quick and very pleasant.   I ordered the California Club pizza - not thin crust.  The pizza had baked in chicken and crunch applewood bacon.  It was good, but on top there was spinach/avocado/cheese - just on top.  So it was like I was eating a salad on top of my pizza, it was messy in a not fun way.  Imagine your toppings constantly falling off, it was too much work to eat this pizza.  I prefer the good ole fashioned toppings melted with cheese on top. Get the peach lemonade - SO good, I had three (free) refills

Back in my college days, I worked at a CPK so I always have a soft spot for this place.  I've only done take-out and delivery at this place so I can't say much about the in-restaurant dining experience, but the delivery and take out has been consistently good.  The times that I've gone to pick it up, you can see the take-out person double-checking to make sure everything is in there, and asking how many utensils I need.  They recently partnered with Santa Monica High School for a fundraiser where they donate 20% of sales to the school and I really appreciate establishments that support the community.   My favorite items are the BBQ Chicken Pizza, BBQ Chicken Salad (add avocado), Waldorf Chicken Salad, and the Mediterranean Spring Rolls.

Love the Jambalaya here! My girlfriend and I always order the Jambalaya and we are never disappointed! The noodles were cooked perfectly, it had a bit of a kick to it (we wanted it to be spicier, but that's okay!), and there was plenty of chicken and shrimp in it! We also ordered the Kung Pao Spaghetti, which was interesting, but quite a disappointment. Something was missing....or there was too much of something (probably peanuts)... but I definitely won't order it again. Just wanted to try it! Service was great! We sat at the bar, and although it was super busy, the bartenders were very attentive to us.

My family loves the pizzas at this place - their favorite being the Thai pizza. I can't eat anything containing gluten and I really appreciate their menu offerings directing which items are gluten free. The salad dressings of the salads I've had are rather bland - definitely could use more flavor. The food is fine, just not incredible. Service is fluctuating in how good it is. Sometimes fine, sometimes not so great.

A Drug Rep came bought us food from CPK for lunch today, It was sooo good.  The spaghetti was amazing, noodles were thin and very tasty. Also had the BBQ Chicken pizza... That pizza is full of onions but it tastes amazing.  Not sure how the service is since I did not go into the store myself but the food tasted great so the cooks did a great job! 2 thumbs up lol I will visit the store in person and update on how the service is :)

I'm gonna give two stars for the great pizza and zero stars for the weak service. Went here on a Wednesday night and the restaurant seemed pretty slow so there really is no excuse for the weak service. My girlfriend ordered a strawberry mojito and what she got back was a strawberry margarita. Great. We ordered the habanero carnitas pizza and it was delicious but our server didn't offer any parmesan cheese or pepper to go along with our pizza. And what really pissed me off was that our waitress didn't come around to see if we needed anything else. if she would have checked in on us she would have seen that we needed a refill for our waters but she  didn't and we were over there eating the spiciest pizza that CPK has to offer. Overall I'll probably eat here again just because the food is good but I'll probably stop by a 7/11 beforehand and grab something to drink to go along with my meal.

Food good. Service awful. I think that our server Andrea had trouble hearing our order. That was the beginning of the problem. She brought the kids' food out first, good idea, but one was not what kid ordered... Took it back and brought the right one.... Ok. Then brought my food.... Ok.... Much later brought hubby's pizza... Not what he ordered... Took it back... His pizza finally came after we were all finished eating... I could not believe that she charged us for it... But did not want to  bring it up with kids and grandma in tow... Also when we paid, this waitress brought our change in 20's... With all this, we were still doing to leave her a 15 to 20% tip and she even made that hard on us. I think she actually might mean well, she's just a bit off. :(  I love cpk. It's great for families. The original cpk opened in BH when I was a kid... My recent experiences at cpk, are making me lose the love.
It's not the best by any means. Standard franchise food. We came for a last minute bite.

Ok, what's with CPK? Over and over their take out services are some of the worse. They have inexperience kids putting take out orders and they are always ssslllooowwww and always forget something. Tonight I place my take out on line to see if this would make it better. No, it didn't help. I think they are unfortunately ob their way out. To bad for the place who brought us pizza like Spago Oh yea they are long gone too.

This is one of the few remaining decent, family-friendly restaurants remaining in this part of Santa Monica, and for that alone it's worth 5 stars. I'm a little bored with the menu options, but that's just because I've been here so many times. The service is usually good, and as a dad who usually eats here with my three kids, I appreciate the fact that they have large bottles of beer (22 - 25 oz).
Great food and great service I defiantly recommend it! I am giving four stars because it is hard to find a parking other than that this place is great!

CPK is consistent.  Bf and I stopped here over the weekend.  I ordered the Kung Pao spaghetti, flat bread pizza and salad.  Penny was our server. Everything tasted as expected.  Penny was especially helpful.

The pepperoni pizza here is great just a bit on the oily side. The penne pasta was really good although we did ask for no chicken and they served it with chicken, but it was totally cool and they let us have it with no extra charge. I liked the opened space plan and overall had great time, will come back again (:

One thing that I enjoy about CPK is that the food is consistent between each of it's restaurants.  This location is no exception of that fact.  The restaurant was clean, the waitstaff was attentive, and the food was delicious.  One thing that I have noticed with both this CPK and the one located off of Hollywood Blvd is that they use a particular Olive Oil that has a much more buttery flavor than at other locations- it's quite good. I would return here again and would suggest it to others.

The Brentwood location is just "ok." My last two times going, I have waited a bit too long in my opinion for my food. My most recent visit was so-so. The staff was very friendly, however my waitress was a bit forgetful with what my friend & I both ordered and I'm a big fan of attention to detail. I've had better experiences at other CPK locations, but like I said, this one isn't horrible.

We went there on the Thursday nights. We were seated immediately. We ordered the tortilla soup which is really good. I highly recommended. We also ordered the chicken salad which is pretty good but the chicken is cold. We also got the salmon dinner however the fish was way too fishy, and honestly we could not eat it. Over all the waitress was great. Our   experience was really good but I would not order the fish  again ..

My wife and I had been craving some unique pizza and we knew we could find it at CPK. It was very close to our hotel, so that helped in our pizza selection. We got the Taco pizza and thought it was great. It's changed since we had it last. Thinner crust and black beans, though that last one I can't be sure. We haven't been to CPK in a long time since there isn't one close to our house, but the Taco and Pear Gorgonzola pizzas are our favorites.

I just enjoyed the Jambalaya pasta at California Pizza. The food was Great!! but the customer service was unprofessional. At the end of my meal, I was told about a 20% discount that people could get if they work on the 3rd St Promenade. Well, I work on 2nd (around the corner). The bar manger Jake was extremely rude when letting me know that I couldn't receive the discount. Instead of saying "Hey we normally don't give the 20% discount unless you work on the promenade" he opted to shout it out and say that it was only for promenade employees. The manner in which he handled the situation was extremely unnecessary. He made it very clear that I wasn't a valued customer. My bill was $17.84, 20% would have been $3.57. Jake was so worried about losing ALMOST $4 instead of me returning back. I definitely won't go back and I'll make sure to let my coworkers know so they think twice about going there themselves.

Very bad service today!!!! Either the waitress is new or really doesn't know what she's doing... First we got a dish that we didn't order, then my husband got his fish tacos WITH the dressing after I made sure the waitress puts down NO dressing, then he got it with no dressing but without the avocados he requested, and then asked for more salsa which never made it to our table....  She's not getting her tip today that's for sure!

We stopped here last weekend during our short trip up the coast. It was my first time at CPK and I loved it. Service was great, I'm sad I can't remember our servers name, he was really nice and quick.
I always come her with my wife and kids and absolutely love the food specially the Thai and baha spring rolls. The Thai crunch salad is also very good with the peanut sauce.

CPK holds a dear place in my heart because of its yummy food and multiple memories at their various locations. Food is always on par and reasonably priced.The stars are just for the food.  The service at this location however, was just embarrassing. Slowest lunch service of my life. My aunt had to remind the waitress multiple times just to bring water and bread. Wait..aren't these staple items in sit down type restaurants?? She wasn't rude or anything, just very, umm forgetful? The table next to us arrived after us but got bread and water first. It seems they were majorly understaffed for this Monday lunch time.

Man this place sucks... I can't believe this place still exists. Me and my family came here on Saturday I ordered the jambalaya fettuccini  my son ordered a pasta plate as well and my lil girl a pepperoni pizza and wifey got a pasta plate as well and all dishes sucked my wife's plate had pesto in it which gave it a lil flavor but man I can't believe how bad this place is and over priced. Never coming back.

My husband and I are from Upstate NY, dining out back home was generally a pleasant experience.  We spent the past 11 months living in Silicon Valley and mostly had anywhere from poor to awful experiences when dining out.  I had friends in SV who also experienced the same problems. Since we moved to CA we have been to a lot of CPK restaurants and we figured we would give the Santa Monica location a try.  For the most part, 80% of our CPK visits up in NorCal were positive ones.  We had a GREAT experience at the Santa Monica restaurant!  The staff (hostess, waiter & manager) were AWESOME.  Our food came out quickly and accurately.  Our waiter was very polite and attentive.  I was impressed by this place and we will definitely be back again.

Walked by and decided to stop by and have dessert. I was hoping to have their tiramisu but found out that they discontinued it. I was disappointed but decided to try their butter cake at the bar with a cup of coffee. The service was good. He took our order but didn't bother to check back. He was helping another  customer and I noticed he was using his cell phone, unprofessional. I would come back again because of the great food.

This is one of my favorite CPK locations! Shout out to Karla for her attention to details and smiling happy disposition at the take out area. In fact all of the staff at this spot go above and beyond to make sure everything is great. Thanks y'all keep it up!

Accommodated me and my friends who walked in with 6 longboards. Great friendly service and delicious food. The manager was extremely friendly, and passionate about the level of care we all received. Great overall experience!
Wow! What an amazing adventure. The crew here have gone out of their way to make us feel special and most importantly welcome. Excellent food, great vibe ~ we thank you all!!

Great service from Jesse! Wow! We have been here so many times and have always enjoyed the customer service but he really stands out - that's why I am writing this review! He was attentive, kind and his personal touches like making handles for a to-go bag and letting us know when the kitchen was delayed made our lunch today so wonderful!! The food was great too - we had a complicated order and be remembered every detail!  Thanks Jesse! Thanks CPK Santa Monica! Give this guy a raise and make him a trainer to show how other servers should be!

It was solid. I really have no complaints, because it was pretty much as I expected.  Avocado BLT egg rolls as an app, then thai chicken and hawaiian pizzas for dinner. They all tasted like what they were supposed to..maybe the hawaiian coulda had a little more sauce on it. All in all, it was expensive pizza that served a purpose at the time. Probably wouldn't be my first choice to go back, but sometimes people I'm with want to eat here, and I will oblige.

This is my favorite dinner spot every time I come here to Third street promenade. Yes, it's a chain, and yes there's many but this spot had not only the nicest people but I swear they have the best food and what more can I ask for since it is also right by the beach, like a block away. I've always ordered the BBQ chicken pizza but today I ordered the Pesto penne multigrain and it was amazing. The ONLY negative is for $3 extra, I really had hardly any chicken and let me tell you, I like my chicken! I think I only got about three super tiny pieces I seriously almost contemplated bringing back the order or asking my server but they were so nice, I kept my mouth shut this time. And despite the long wait time for my mom to get her strawberry refresher, it really wasn't bad. I love coming here. Highly recommend.

I went here with my boyfriend for lunch to celebrate our 1 year anniversary this past Wednesday and had a great time! We shared the original BBQ chicken chopped salad and it was so delicious! My boyfriend got a beer and I tried their hand shaken agave mojito, which tasted great. It was sweet, but not overly sweet and the mint in it made it taste so refreshing. Our waiter was super nice and hospitable; he really helped make our CPK experience enjoyable! Overall, great experience. The salad and drinks were great choices, especially since it was so hot outside! Nothing like a cool salad and refreshing drinks on a hot summer day. Glad we chose to have lunch here to celebrate our special day. (:
Love their salad pizzas!   I wish their frozen pizzas in the stowe were original crust and vegetarian, but the store is wonderful.  Also, save room for their hot fudge sundae!

My family and I were at this location to relax and eat after a fairly long day at court, we entered to a nice atmosphere meaning very nice interior restaurant however service was disgustingly horrible and the restrooms were horrendously filthy my mother refused to use them when, we ordered and had to ask several times for bread while we wait, they were out apparently. When attempting to wave down someone for refills we kept getting walked past and at one point had their older bus boy stare at us as we attempted to get help, he made sure not to help as well. When we received our appetizer and salad I was very disappointed in the salad it was a very small "half" portion I can only assume that the "large" would make a small salad at "Buca di Beppo" (for those who know the sizes) definitely not worth the price they charge. We then received the pizza. That too was not worth what they charge. 15$ for a pizza the size of a traditional round china plate and 14$ for the other equally small pizza. For half that price I can make from scratch a better fresh pizza because YES the pizza sent to us both had old ingredients you could clearly see had begun to rot. I spoke to the manager who apologized and said they had a new expediter and replaced the browning smooshy avocados with fresh green ones. Over all we spent 110$ and ate one third of what we order. We took food to go after picking off rotting vegetables but collectively agreed that the local homeless may appreciate the food as we had all lost out appetites. Personally I would not recommend this location to anyone. Staff is lacking in good work ethic and someone dropped the ball on restroom cleaning hard. Their chef and cooks also should know better than to send out rotting vegetables and fruit as fresh topping.

I went to CPK because my friend Chris called me after work and gathered the troops to do some grubbin.. So we went to dinner and it was delicious, everything was perfect, Jonah couldn't of been sweeter, he came around checking how everything was. I would most definitely go back!  Thanks Jonah!!

Absolutely disgusting! They brought us dirty plates with food still extremely visible.. It took 1 hour to get our food. And then when it came time to give us our desserts they said it had been only 10 mins. Terrible service. Was the worst service I've ever had. Worst CPK ...

Ever since they remodeled, their service had been abdolute shit. we got here and no one came to take our drink order until 15 minutes after we arrived. Another group of ppl arrived after us and the employees immediately attended their needs. We finally ordered our food and then the manager said that if it was morw than 15 minutes, we wld get free desserts. Bold face lie. We know we waited more than 15 min and we knew it was more than 15 and the lady said that it was only 10 min. We said fuck it, and left. I guess it's cuz we are young adults but we still deserve better service than what they gave us.

Gone are the days of a mediocre, overpriced meal.  On a whim, we decided we'd give CPK a shot again, this after a VERY long break from it.  We were pleasantly surprised that the interior is set up really nicely.  They've also changed up their menu, while still keeping a lot of their classics... Bread and butter was also surprisingly good too.   Think this is going to be one of our regular dinner spots to mix into our rotation. :)

CPK,,, is usually reliable.  I know I can go there to get a good ribeye steak or the Sicilian pizza with fresh garlic.   The bartender at this location, Anthony was a cool cat that reminded me of the old school bartenders.  Where you go and just hang out. Anthony made you feel like you were family.  I frequent CPK but usually in BevHills but I will definitely be back to chill with Anthony, from the Midwest. You need more people like him.  With technology dominating our lives, it's nice to see someone who knows how to have a conversation and be sincere about it.

OMG!  My family and I decided to eat at California pizza kitchen on Wilshire and 2nd st in Santa Monica at 12noon ,  The Food and Service was just below satisfactory!   Our Bill was $43.58  I handed the Server $60.00 she asked if I needed change back ?   Yes please !   She gave $16.00 back,  I politely asked that I was short .42 cents .  Her answer was ,  customers do Not like COINS FOR CHANGE!!!!  SO IF YOU WANT IT, I WILL GIVE IT TO YOU!!!!!  That is so unacceptable !!!  NO,  you can keep it!!  I WILL NEVER EAT THER AGAIN!!!!!

the food was average and the service was quite average. the parking was terrible. the neighborhood at night was quite poor. The parking is terrible here.  Santa Monica appears to have degenerated and deteriorated much over the past 10 to 20 years due to lack of parking.....crime.........homelessness........gangs and rent control...... the landlords do not want to keep up their buildings or houses or apartments or even repair them for major problems due to rent control by the city of santa monica.....the people's republic of socialist santa monica........
Had a great experience the service was excellent! The lunch special was perfect! Had the 7" sausage pepperoni mushroom and the spinach salad. It was tasty!

Good service and okay wait time, but the atmosphere and the employees were a bit strange. Low quality service when under pressure. Do not recommend eating here when they are busy. Other than that, great food.

Portions are really stingy. I don't know why I keep ordering from there. The portions just get smaller and smaller each time. The asparagus and arugula salad was the stingiest. You get a handful of dry arugula and two 1-inch stumps of asparagus. What's going on CPK?  I think I've learned my lesson now. Never again.
Great thin crust margarita pizza. Service quick, people nice. New waiter Justin did great job. Music a tad loud.

Went here for lunch, Order soup and plate, Was asked by the waiter if I want my soup before food, Yes please my answer, after 25 minutes wait the manager and the waiter bring us the food first and then the soup after, Gave a nasty look manger offering the soup is on us I told him he can have it. What a retard people working there. Going on a regular base at least twice a month in Glendale not comparison to this place.

On the whole a solid, unexciting, reasonably priced meal. The pizzas are good, though not great. The bbq chicken was the best one we tried. I did love their tortilla soup which was hearty and wholesome and handily comes in 3 sizes so you can order appropriate to your hunger level. The wine selection is safe and average, middling even. Some safe Californians by the glass etc. A small complaint was none of the cocktails are priced on the menu so it's hard to know what you are ordering. So I didn't. The dining room has a somewhat tinny coldish vibe, more suited to summer evenings than the current wintery temps. The service was decent, friendly eager to assist wait staff and hosts. This place is fine, I wouldn't scramble to recommend it and it's not special but it's a good safe bet for some casual eats in Santa Monica near the beach and promenade.

Doesn't even deserve one star ! This location previously did curb side - I assumed they still did - not that uncommon for cpk They refused to do it and i Had a $500 order for the tv show I'm on today but because I'm glued to my van watching 50K in equipment - i couldn't run in and pay and just asked if they can run out for my Amex - My vechicle was parked directly in front of banana republic and they refused to accommodate us! Poor customer service and not business oriented people ! Gross you guys lost my biz forever  Oh and thanks for leaving me on hold for ten minutes

Very nice location. Plenty of booths and not much people when we arrived at 11:30am. Been a while since I've been here but their menu seems to be similar. Had their Waldorf salad and my friend and I split a Hawaiian pizza. Portion was huge! Definitely more than enough for one person. Didn't take too long for our food to arrive. When we were ready to leave it was hard to find our waiter though. Flagged down another server to get our check. Parking is available on Ocean. Just have to walk a few blocks. You can also try the structures but you may have to circle to the top.

Heard so much good things about this pizzeria. Not impressed at all. Maybe I would be more satisfied if I didn't hear that many positive feedbacks. My expectations were not satisfied. Not the best place to have pizza. Overall service was good.
Confession...I didn't stop here for pizza. I had a craving for my favorite alcoholic drink, and my thirst was definitely quenched! Here, you can get a good Sangria for $8.99! Great value!

I went her Saturday night before the theater for a special celebration.  They seated 15 young people (all who looked well under 21) very close to us at a high top large table.  Some of these kids seemed to have had quite a bit to drink before they arrived.  My friend and I couldn't help but notice that the staff served them alcohol without (it appeared) asking them for an ID.  They were extremely loud and obnoxious and on 2 occasions drinks ended up crashing to the floor.  The last one got our table all wet (thank goodness we were getting ready to leave) and soaked my shoes.   The biggest complaint I had wit this table was that these kids kept throwing the F Bomb around every other minute.  While a girl was cleaning up their mess by my table, I asked to speak tto the Manager.  He came by, heard all of the bad language and raised voices and just shrugged his shoulders and told us that he had already spoken to this table about the problem but that they were ignoring him.   He said that, by law, he could not ask them to leave..........even after continuing to ask them to calm down.  The restaurant was also continuing to serve alcohol to some of these kids who were obviously drunk when they walked in.  This is totally unacceptable behavior on the part of CPK management.  He just told us he was sorry but did not even offer us a dessert (not that we would have considered staying to have one.)   My shoe was soaking wet ant this horrible experience ended up ruining our entire evening. Why a restaurant would continue serving alcohol to young kids, as full drinks were being knocked off the table onto the floor is beyond me.  This was totally irresponsible behavior on the part of Management and I would never go back to this place.  I know as a fact that we were not the only table that complained about these kids. I PLAN ON SHARING THIS REVIEW ON VARIOUS SOCIAL MEDIA OUTLETS.

We were shooting a commercial at the Fairmont across the street.  The catering thru the hotel was so expensive and they wouldn't let us bring our own caterer.  So what'd we do? We had our 80 crew members walk across the street to CPK!  Logan was extremely helpful in organizing a buffet for my crew.  She helped out with knowing quantities of food, she was responsive, polite and a pleasure to work with.  Many of my crew members were grumpy and hesitant as they hadn't always had a good experience at CPK.  After lunch I got RAVE. REVIEWS.  Rave reviews from MULTIPLE crew members on how delicious the food was, how attentive the wait staff was and how great of an experience it was.  I think you may have won back a few future customers after yesterdays lunch. Thanks for everything.

I came to this location for the first time on a Friday night. There was a 10 minute wait for two, but it felt much shorter because the host was very charming, and he kept me and my friend company while we waited. Our waiter, Thomas was very accommodating and he took our orders and brought us our drinks very promptly. Me and my friend shared their yummy spinach dip as an appetizer and followed with their quinoa and arugula salad tossed with their house made vinaigrette. My friend quickly finished her plate of ZUCCHINI noodles and shrimp. We ended our meal with their famous butter cake, and like the menu says in the description, "Trust us, just try it," indeed we did, and we were very glad to have trusted them. Over all, such a wonderful experience. Starting from the host at the door, to the delicious food, to the friendly and great service from Thomas, to when we walked out the door. The manager, Jonah, even asked how everything was and wished us a good rest of our evening. I'll be definitely back very soon to indulge on my true love, their Belgian Chocolate Soufflé! (No offense Butter Cake!) My go-to CPK location from now on~
Food is delicious  Beers are great  Dessert amazing but Service...FANTASTIC! Love our server Marx!

location: West Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
review: The waiter was really nice and attentive but the food is terrible. I ordered the mahi mahi tacos and the tortilla was cold and it was just not edible.  It seriously just looked like they took the ingredients out of the fridge and placed them on a plate. Taco tortillas are not meant to be cold. My mother ordered a panini and the bread was cold as well. I only gave this place two stars because of the great waiter but the food is horrible. I have been to other CPK restaurants and I have never had such bad food.

I have to say that I love this place, the customer service is the best part of this Resturant, Penny was not even our table server, but she was keep walking around to make sure we're ok. Josh is awesome too, I enjoyed my dinner tonight very much.

I'm giving one star just for the pleasure of writing a bad take out rating.  I placed my order through Yelp to their restaurant.  An hour later, I called to see where the order was, they had no record of it and grilled me on which method I used to place my order.  If I order through Yelp, shouldn't they understand that?  I received a confirmation number but was nowhere in their system.  I now have to make sure they didn't take the money from my account.  THAT will be a serious problem. After reading the other negative posts for delivery, I agree.  Do not order from them. **** A follow up to this review:  they did take the money out of my account.  My husband called to speak to the manager with no result.
Pad thai chicken pizza was too salty.   TV moniters played sports.  Fuck.  I want to watch Korean drama.

One of my favorite places ,food excellent ,its a friendly atmosphere its great, employees very friendly and eager to take care of you i always bring my friends , i recommend everything specially to start spinach dip , will be back soon Jesse our waiter the best .

It's been awhile since my last review, so I thought I would write one today. We walked inside in between lunch and dinner so it was no problem getting a booth. The interior is revamped, remodeled! It looks clean, industrial, country chic. I ordered my favorite, the Thai Chicken Crunch salad because I love cabbage, crispy wontons and the Thai peanut sauce. My husband ordered the chicken piccata which looked really delicious and he said it was perfect! For dessert we ordered the butter cake with vanilla ice cream! The cake was moist and tasty! Service was efficient, friendly and professional. I like CPK for their consistency, and tasty food.
The usual CPK experience. Nothing extraordinary about this one. Pleasant service.

This is by far the slowest and worst customer service of all CPK chain. You as customer are last. They rush you and manager are barely.This should be way better at this PRIME Santa Monica location. The lights are so bright, it's like being in a factory with them as they huddle, and not too busy at all. Very stressful to order and eat. Never any specials or happy hour. Not user friendly to underprivileged community. You must be elite to eat here. Pizza states at $14 with the bare bones. Management is nonexistent here. Bartenders keep talking to customers and ignore other customers and make them wait, this is commonplace for Cpk in Santa Monica.

The WORST!!!! Ordered 3 pizzas an hour and a half in advance for pick up at 6:40 PM and got there at 6:45 and at 7:15 they were still not ready.  Manager would not come to the phone after 4 calls to ask to speak to him/her.   Never again!!.

Great place to stop by if your craving pizza and a overall good meal! I really enjoyed this place, I've been here twice and I wasn't disappointed. The pizza was hot and fresh. And don't get me started with the salads! The salad I had was spectacular! And the dessert? Get the butter cake and ask with strawberries and ice cream. I really enjoyed the butter cake it was warm and melted in your mouth as soon as you took a bite of it. Overall, I would come back again and again.

This pizza kitchen is always crazy busy no matter what time it is. When we went in it was about 6 in the evening. the line was long but seemed to move quick. We finally got seated and were met by a server quick. our drinks came right out and we ordered food. the food came out fast too. we did not have to wait like I thought we would considering how many people were inside.  The food was great and the service was great! the prices were in line with the rest of the CPK stores. The place was clean and well kept. the management here does a great job insuring service and good food!! They are well staffed and it makes a big difference for sure. Everything was great on our visit!!! Thank you CPK !
Food was good, but we spent 10 minutes trying or grab our server's attention for our check.

The staff is very friendly and courteous.  The restaurant is very clean and well maintained.  Food arrived at a very reasonable amount of time (no longer than 10 minutes). HOWEVER This isn't traditional pizza. It's a very watered down version of it. The crust is extremely thin and lacking mozarella on the traditional Pepperoni pizza. I also found the food to be lacking in taste.  If you decided to come here to get some good pizza, I suggest trying somewhere else.

What a terrible experience. The had the worst customer service I've seen in a very, very long time. Someone's lunch was completely missing from our order, and the manager was extremely unhelpful, and shockingly rude. I'll never, ever go there again.

Sandwiches were horrible. Don't think my dog would eat them. Service terrible. My wife and I in a hurry and told Waiter. Sandwiches served 30 minutes later and wife had to leave for appt. so had them box up hers. Poor service, food and expensive for that terrible food. DO NOT GO THERE.

The Rib-eye is to die for - better than most uber expensive steak houses. The Chicken Piccata is delicious. I have been eating at this restaurant at least three times a week for three years. Excellent customer services and the food quality and attention to detail is far superior to other CPK locations in Los Angeles. My only issue is the smart phone app crashes and the Grub Hub delivery service does not relay special instructions.
Tremendously good food for the price- I have noticed that Sam & Evelyn, two of the managers, really help keep the food quality consistent & also deliver on superlative customer service.

So, crazy story, went there last night and was sitting at a booth in a group of 5. My friend got up and asked the manager if she could use a phone charger because her phone was dead, and he said no. So when she came back to the table and said "the manager's kind of a douchebag." Little did she know he followed her back to the table, and then he yelled at her for like 5 mins, making a scene, saying he won't be disrespected like that, and how there's kids around, which is like... yeah okay no one can hear us talking quietly amongst ourselves, and he literally wouldn't let up, he tried to force her to apologize which I thought was super creepy. Then as he was leaving she said he was being dramatic and he came back and started yelling all over again. He was like inconsolable. I thought it was really unprofessional and embarrassing for him and I won't be dining there again for sure. Food was good though if that's what you're into. Got the lettuce cups and the veggie pizza with no cheese, sub extra veggies. Bomb.

My wife and I randomly had a day off and decided to make the most of it. We figured it was going to be busy as heck today but still took a chance with CPK.  We lucked out getting here early and we're pleasantly surprised about the $35 special for Valentine's Day so we decided why not.  Our waiter Thomas was exceptional! Great customer service, great attentiveness to what we wanted and even gave some amazing recommendations. He was all around an ideal person to assist us during dinner. I can definitely say he made tonight a very special night since we don't usually have days off like this. Food was amazing! The bbq chicken pizza and Kung Pow spaghetti was phenomenal! Overall tonight's dinner was nothing less than marvelous.   Thank you for making tonight one for the books! Definitely coming back here and hope Thomas is working then too! :)
My ALLLL time favorite salad in the world is the Quinoa Arugula Salad with Salmon at CPK. I have visited this location twice after work and the service  has been great.

The restaurant is very clean and well maintained.  Food arrived at a very reasonable amount of time.  CPK has some good pizzas, but not all of them. Rest of the menu has really good dishes. We tried a CedarPlank Salmon, Garlic Cream Fettucine. You should try deserts as well and mango strawberry cooler. The staff is very friendly and courteous. We have been here a couple times and have always enjoyed the customer service.

A big visitor at CPK here in Westchester we just had to visit California PK here in California. And it was great. Much nicer and more of a dining experience but still had the kids. Nicer and more Comprehensive wine collection. The mac n cheese bites were good. Two new soups featured a delicious sweet squash soup stocked with fresh veggies and an equally delicious potato purée. The Waldorf salad was excellent and all fresh. The pizza was also very good (of course). Typical fun venue.

This location is very bad!!! They dont read the special instructions i included in my order. Messed up totally my order and when i called them did not bother to correct. All they said is that they are very busy right now. So basically what they tried to tell me is that they didnt have the time to read my special instruction coz they are very busy - so screw u. Wow!!! Sams service was on point!! Took great care of us on a to go order and gave my pup water. Stay awesome man!!
I went there before they close, the service was like I totally understand they really wanted to go home. Cus it was really bad

osh is the best thing that ever happened to cpk. We had a huge party very last minute and he was so accommodating and friendly. Even with our high demanding party he kept his cool and delivered the best service we could have asked for. Will definitely come back just for him!

I'm not super in love with CPK because their foods tend to be super salty/fatty. However, if you are looking for delicious food that you will want more and more of, then you are coming to the right place. They have so many options on their menu and I've had almost all of them over the years. If you have never tried CPK, you really should give it chance because they have such a wide selection of delicious pizzas, salads, kinds of pasta, and sandwiches. I love this place because it is a quick in-and-out for lunch and the service is always great. They also have a rewards program so you can add up points from all your purchases and save money over time. It's a decent place so go there if you're just trying to have some good food. not a good date place and not fancy or classy in any way.

Haven't had CPK in awhile - came to Santa Monica on a cold Saturday evening for my birthday, wanting to celebrate by the pier. But unfortunately it was raining incredibly hard by the time we made it out to Santa Monica. Ended up ducking into CPK for dinner and to wait out the rain.  This CPK is a bit fancier than the ones I've been to. Seems like the floorplan is executed well - with a round, bar-like area in the middle with low lights hanging over the seats. Very comfy indeed. Right when you walk in, you're greeted at the front of the house by several workers. Because we came during a huge storm, there weren't too many customers and the workers seemed to be much more relaxed and eager for the holidays. We were told to sit anywhere we wanted. Very friendly service, and our server was super chill and helpful throughout the night.  Ended up ordering the classic CPK dishes that I usually enjoy eating.  Fettucine Alfredo with chicken: Even though the portion size isn't too big, the creaminess of the alfredo sauce really packs a punch, getting you full pretty quickly. With the added parmesan cheese and chicken pieces, this dish was a hit. I've always been a fan of this dish at all CPK's, and this one didn't disappoint.  BBQ Chicken pizza: a classic pizza although this time it didn't taste as good as I remembered it to taste. A bit dry and not as tasty (maybe the sauce was lacking on the pizza?); but nonetheless, it hit the spot and satisfied our hunger cravings.  And our server was incredibly nice, throwing in a birthday dessert surprise for me, topped with a candle and whipped cream! I think it was some sort of brownie with chocolate syrup, whipped cream, and some candy - it definitely ended the night on a high note.  Don't forget to ask for complimentary bread and dip once you have ordered.  tl;dr - Solid food although I would probably expect a bit more from this CPK since it's located close to the pier. The service was pretty great, putting us both at ease despite the heavy rain outside. Wasn't disappointed at all that I ended up celebrating my birthday here!

I have been eating at CPK my whole life and have ordered this salad sooo many times. I know what the portions are like and this was definitely not it. One of the worst CPK's  I have been to and I have been to quiet a few. Went there yesterday evening it took them 40 mins to come check on us after we sat down. Then we ordered our food and waited 30 to 35 mins and at that point I got fed up and just walked out. The past few times that I have gone it's never been a great experience either.

If you have any dietary restrictions, you had better check online yourself before going there and plan out what you will be ordering. Our waiter knew NOTHING. Not only that, but he wouldn't stay around long enough for us to ask all our questions so that we could place an order. Every question, he kept running off and saying he will be right back. He would disappear for minutes at a time. One in our party has a vegan diet. Another one has food allergies. We asked if eggs are used in any bread or pizza dough for the vegan. He said ALL of their dough and pasta contains eggs. How can that be? I asked him to ask the manager. I know eggs are not used in pizza dough and most pasta. He comes back to confirm that YES, ALL THE DOUGH AND PASTA CONTAINS EGGS. At this point, I'm totally confused. Our vegan settled on a salad and because of his lack of knowledge, I'm thinking I need to order a la cart so I can put together an allergy free meal for my kid. I asked him what vegetables they have for side dishes. Instead of answering me, he said, he'll be right back. He throws an incomplete dietary guide on the table for me to look through and takes off. I look at it. It only had calorie counts on the main dishes and not the ingredients or even side dishes. I had enough. It's been well over 15 minutes of back and forth with him and we didn't have any answers to our questions. We literally could not order anything or make any headway. We had no choice but to leave because we could not get serviced. We went to another restaurant a block away and their staff was knowledgeable and attentive. Everyone was able to eat. When I got home, I opened their complete dietary guide online. It states, All pizza dough can be used to make vegan pizza. It even gives examples how. All pasta can be used. It does show that the dough and pasta shares equipment, but it doesn't actually contain the eggs. Additionally any Gluten free dough is certified and vegan so it doesn't share any equipment. Why was this so difficult? It's not everyday we can get our family together to go out, so this really ruined our night. It could have been so simple if this waiter would have been better trained and stuck around to finish our order.  We have been going to this particular restaurant since it opened. It had a rough patch with service, but got it together after the remodel. Until this last time we came. Looks like they are heading back to their old ways. Train your staff better and hire people who want to help and be of service. More and more people have dietary restrictions for one reason or another. It can be food allergies, or health or lifestyle or newly developed intolerances in highly allergic people. Your menu states you can accommodate, but your staff doesn't know how to answer questions to help people work around the menu.

I like this place. We come here as a family with 2 small kids. Their pizza is really good and you can either order from the menu or customize it anyway you wish. I love avocado rolls, they have a lot of calories but so worth it. In the summer they serve sangria tastings which is 3 variety of sangria  drinks with different flavors, it's so yummy!!! Their fish tacos are pretty tasty too. Really anything we tried was good. On the side note, they host kids cooking classes and I signed my daughter up, it was so much fun! I ordered a salad to go & even pretipped them.  The cook made it wrong twice.  The guy making sure the order was corrected properly & the cook were making comments where they were visible to me.  So unprofessional.  Do your job right & be apologetic when you screw up instead of making the customer feel like they're wrong.

I intended to go to Hillstone down the street but the wait was too long and all I had was 30 min. on my meter so I decided to head back to my car and go to another area that wasn't as packed.   I was parked right in front of California Pizza Kitchen, so I spontaneously opted to eat here instead.  The place was packed but there wasn't a wait so I was seated immediately.  But because it was packed, my food didn't come out for about 20 minutes.  I had only 6 minutes left on my meter so I asked an employee walking by if he knew whether the meter in front of his restaurant would allow me to just add more money or if it was one of those meters that won't allow you to recycle.   He didn't know the answer.  Now most people would have said I don't know and walk away.  Luis Pablo however inquired around and then inform me that I would need to move my car because it's one of those meters that won't allow you to refill.   Now if you're familiar with the 3rd Street Promenade area, you'll know that the minute you drive out of your parking space, there will be someone who will immediately pull in as this is a heavily visited area, especially on a Saturday of the Thanksgiving weekend.  To my pleasant surprise, Luis offered to block the space for me as I pull out and then pull back in.  It only took me 2 minutes to get this done but the fact that he offered to go the extra mile to help me speaks volume on his exemplary customer service.   If the food was excellent, I would have given this place 5 stars, but since the food was good but not necessarily excellent, I'm giving this restaurant 4 star, again predominantly for Luis' superlative customer service than the food.  The garlic chicken dish was not as tender as my personal palate would have preferred (possibly over cooked and hence somewhat on the dry side). I also felt that the sauce was a bit salty for my personal palate (but most restaurants are a little too salty for my low sodium preference).  I did enjoy my cucumber reviver drink however. I don't review all the restaurants I eat at, only ones that either impressed me or unimpressed me.  I'm not so sure I would associate my receiving outstanding service to the training at CPK because if this were the case, I would have been equally impressed by my waiter, which I wasn't.  He did a decent enough job but it wasn't necessarily anything to write home about.   I made it a point to look at Luis uniform the next time he walked by so I could see his name tag, only then did I discover that he was a culinary lead.  All this time I thought he was just a busboy.  I'm not sure what a culinary lead is necessarily but that "lead" tells me he must be a leader of some sort.  I can totally see why CPK elected to make him a leader.  He not only represents his company well, he is truly a deserving asset to this restaurant.  It's the small simple thing like this (which most can do but won't) that makes a visit memorable and an employee to stand out above the rest.
